I'm going into the deep end when thinking about unit tests.
Do we define the constants w.r.t the C++ assumed numeric limits or based on torch.eq-operator? And where can I find those definitions?

Examples;

import torch
from torch import finfo

x = torch.tensor([[0]],dtype=torch.float64)

x+finfo(x).eps!=x # True
x+finfo(x).eps/2==x # True
x+finfo(x).tiny==x # True
x+(finfo(x).eps-finfo(x).tiny)==x # False! Why?
finfo(x).max+finfo(x).tiny==float('Inf') # TODO

Any pointers @fritzo? 😃

https://github.com/ragulpr/pytorch/tree/extend-finfo

I'm going into the deep end when thinking about unit tests.
Do we define the constants w.r.t the C++ assumed [numeric limits](https://en.cppreference.com/w/cpp/types/numeric_limits) or based on torch.eq-operator? And where can I find those definitions? 

Examples;
```
import torch
from torch import finfo

x = torch.tensor([[0]],dtype=torch.float64)

x+finfo(x).eps!=x # True
x+finfo(x).eps/2==x # True
x+finfo(x).tiny==x # True
x+(finfo(x).eps-finfo(x).tiny)==x # False! Why?
finfo(x).max+finfo(x).tiny==float('Inf') # TODO
```

Any pointers @fritzo? 😃
